qas.question: In what year was ministerial government started in the Gilbert and Ellice islands?
What document was changed to cause a change in government?
When was a referendum held to determine the government of Ellice?
What was the determination of the referendum?
What did the Tuvaluan Order 1976 recognize Tuvalu to be?

context: In <a0_0>1974<a0_0/> ministerial government was introduced to the Gilbert and Ellice Islands Colony through a change to the <a1_0>Constitution<a1_0/>. In that year a general election was held; and a referendum was held in <a2_0>December 1974<a2_0/> to determine whether the Gilbert Islands and Ellice Islands should each have their own administration. As a consequence of the referendum, <a3_0>separation<a3_0/> occurred in two stages. The Tuvaluan Order 1975, which took effect on 1 October 1975, recognised Tuvalu as a separate <a4_0>British dependency<a4_0/> with its own government. The second stage occurred on 1 January 1976 when separate administrations were created out of the civil service of the Gilbert and Ellice Islands Colony.
